info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 25 at 2:22AM EDT until August 25 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Greene County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Fayette County in southwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 222 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lawson Heights to near Perryopolis to near Brownsville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Latrobe, Connellsville, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, McChesneytown-Loyalhanna, Lawson Heights, South Connellsville, Farmington, Ligonier, Seven Springs, Calumet-Norvelt, Isabella, Dunbar, Everson, Republic, Vanderbilt, Dawson, Youngstown, and New Salem. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 79 and 99. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
